headline: 3-Ingredient Cake Mix Cobbler
description: This easy peach cobbler is made using cake mix for a quick recipe that could not be more simple. Just 3 ingredients and you are set for a sweet treat.
name: 3-Ingredient Cake Mix Cobbler
recipeIngredient: 2 (15.25 ounce) cans peaches in light syrup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Pour peaches into a baking dish. Sprinkle cake mix on top and pour melted butter all over.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 50 minutes.

review.reviewBody: No changes. I have made this several times; always a favorite.
very easy as well as yummy!

Where I'm from, we call this a "Dump Cake". Most commonly, I make it with crushed pineapples (from a can) and cherry pie filling. It usually only takes me like 45 minutes to bake. The key is to evenly distribute the butter over the raw cake mix powder. I don't even melt the butter, I just slice up a stick and put a dab every half inch, or so. It's so versatile and can be done with any fruit base.
Noo changes I have made this cobbler several times in a Dutch Oven also.

I followed the ingredients cooked it for the 50 minutes I used a can of peaches cake mix and the butter I pulled it out and it's very wet runny and big lumps and uncooked not good at all I was very embarrassed of it sorry but this really doesn't work unless you mix I believe the batter with the peach sauce
I always made fun of the folks who say a dessert is too sweet. Desserts are supposed to be sweet, right? Well, this one is so sweet even a dessert-lover like me couldn't eat it. Never, ever again.
Super easy dessert. I used 1 can if peaches and 1 of plums. I also sprinkled chopped pecans before butter.
Delicious. Easy to make. Everyone loved it. Made from ingredients I had on hand.
I made this with blueberry pie filling. instead of just pouring the butter on top of dry cake mix, i combined them to make a crumble topping. worked out beautifully.
This was crazy easy. Like other's I added vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and brown sugar. Will definitely make again.
Actually, I've been making this grand dessert for years. The most common name for it is dump cake. Originally got the recipe from my auntie. Easy to make and customize.
It looks and taste like mush.
It was quick and easy! And it was pretty good too. A little sweeter than a "real down home southern" peach cobbler but if you need a desert in a hurry for cheap you CAN NOT go wrong!

I bought a fresh pineapple, sliced and grilled it, then chopped it. Put the chopped pineapple in a sauté pan w 1/2 stick butter and 1/2 cup brown sugar, cook until liquid thickens. Then use the recipe as normal. Love it!
I was just in to double check cooking time. My grandmother taught me this recipe years ago. Try it with a couple cans if blueberry pie filling and a can of pineapple chunks or slices (canned)
My husband LUVS IT!!

Family favorite go-to cobble recipe. My kids love this with fresh whipped cream! I have tried it with a variety of other fruits. Peaches, blueberries and a berry mix, the kids found equally delicious.

This needs tweaking. Two cans of sliced, undrained peaches were not enough to cover the bottom of a 9x13" pan, so I used a 9" square pan. The crust was thick, powdery and salty in places, and caramelized in others; the filling was good, but sloppy wet. It's a good concept that needs more peaches in the larger pan, probably partially drained. Worth working on.
So fast & easy, and it was gobbled up!

Because it was my first time making it I do not know if i put to much cake mix or what, because for the most part it cam out right but the piddle was very powdery from the cak mix but on a lighter note it smelled delicious

Really easy and inexpensive. But way, way, way too sweet for me, and some of the topping was rather doughy. I made it exactly to the recipe using 2 cans of sliced peaches in juice and Duncan Hines yellow cake mix. 
Next time, I will try half a box of cake mix, and add some chopped walnuts and oatmeal to it, and cut the cold butter into it like a streusel.
Two more ingredients and another bowl to wash, but it's just too cloying for me as is.
So easy, it shouldn't taste this good - but it does!
Some of the cake mix didn't soak up butter and was dry but otherwise

love this recipe and sooo easy! I used the coffee cake mix instead of the yellow cake mix listed in the recipe. After reading some of the reviews, I sprinkled half of the cake mix on the bottom of the square dish then added my peaches and sprinkled the rest of mix on top. Then topped with the cinnamon melted butter. Delicious!
Super quick & easy and very tasteful. And yes, only used 3 ingredients.
I added a tsp vanilla, about 1/4 cup brown sugar and about 1 tsp lemon juice. I also stirred all ingredients until cake mix was wet. Husband loved it!

Thanks for this easy, inexpensive, and yummy recipe. My
Daughter and grandkids request it all the time!

People thought it was great
 I made the apple one, too. I liked it best. Peaches, w/syrup was too sweet for me. No one else seemed to agree with me.
Very easy and inexpensive. My husband can’t leave it alone!
I use no salt butter

Best Peach Cobbler Ever, truly. Easy to follow directions and the dessert was fantastic! I made it for dinner guests and I’m making it again this weekend for house guests. I will double it next time because I want to have more “leftover”

Love this easy recipe but I used fresh peaches from my tree. Added a little sugar. I used a 9x9 dish and sprinkled enough cake mix to cover where you don’t see peaches. The 2/3 stick of melted butter and bake. Best thing is adding fresh whipped cream!!

I put a can of blueberry pie filling on the bottom of the dish and covered that with sliced peaches, then covered with a yellow cake mix, butter patts. When almost done, I added cinnamon and brown sugar mixed and sprinklered over for the last ten minutes of bake time.

I've now made this 3 times and it still amazes me how good it turns out each time. I think the type of cake mix has a lot to do with it. I've never used the Duncan Hines mixes, but have opted for either a vanilla cake mix from Trader Joes or a cinnamon crumb/coffee cake mix from my local supermarket. I used 1 can of sliced peaches in light syrup and then frozen fresh peach slices (not thawed) to fill the bottom of the baking dish (the cake mixes have enough sugar that no extra sugar is needed). And I also sprinkled vanilla extract over the top of the cake mix before the melted butter. Delicious!!!

This came out like uncooked cake mix and peaches. I think half cake mix placed first in baking dish, then add peaches with liquid then the last half of cake mix topped with melted butter may turn out more like a cobbler. Anyway the taste was great. Just a little embarrassed how it looked. Glad it was just family.

I added the usual to the peaches, brown sugar, vanilla extract , lemon, nutmeg , & cinnamon then I put the cake mix on top and then the butter. It turned out extra yummy, I will definitely be making this again.
I sprinkled a little cinnamon sugar on top of the cobbler before baking. It gave it a nice finish. It is an excellent recipe. Very tasty. A definite do again!
I made this for my family and they Loved it I used fresh peaches and put vanilla ice cream on it. My pic isn't the right size or I would of added that.:(
First time I’ve ever had such an easy recipe! My husband really liked, so it’s a hit at our house, and I’ll make it again! ??
No changes. Very easy to make and very delicious. I will definitely make it again. It’s a great desert to serve company. Top with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream. Serve warm if you like. Awesome.
I have been making this for years, and everyone loves it! I actually prefer this at room temp rather than right out of the oven. It is probably the easiest recipe I’ve ever used but one of the best!
love this recipe. i have used cheery apple and blueberry. want to try black berry or rasberry
It was easy and delicious
Way too sweet for me.
